newsitem.title: ANGOLA: CHEVRON SEES RESULTS ON ANGOLA BLOCK 14 SOON.
newsitem.headline: CHEVRON SEES RESULTS ON ANGOLA BLOCK 14 SOON.

text.p: Results from tests done by U.S.-based oil company Chevron on the Block 14 oil well off Angola's coast will be known by the end of April, a company official said on Tuesday.
"Right now there is no information about the flow rate or the estimated size of the discovery," the official told Reuters.
"Towards the end of the month we should have the test results back and then we might have a better idea."
The block, off Angola's northern-most Cabinda enclave, is one of Chevron's most recent deep water oil discoveries.

The Cabinda Gulf Oil Company (Cabgoc), a subsidiary of Chevron, is the operator on Block 14 in partnership with the Angolan state oil company Sonangol, French-based Total, Agip of Italy and Portugal's Petrogal.
Angola's oil production is worth nearly $4 billion annually, with Chevron one of the biggest companies oeprating in the country.
Chevron is expanding its operations in the country and has forecast oil production for 1997 at around 400,000 barrels a day.
